entry.title: once upon a broken boy (come back to me)
entry.summary:
Author: alleousai

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,427Chapters: 1/9Kudos: 2

Summary: “It happened when an undead certain red-helmeted menace got de-aged to a five-year-old little kid by pure circumstance and one Peter Benjamin Parker – Spider-Man – from a multiverse away had to handle his shit, for better or for worse.”   ↞↠   Jason gets de-aged all the while his brain is snapping back information at him. No one knows how he did or why or where he went, but one totally normal guy from another universe might just be the cure. But hey, Peter gets a job. And Bruce gets a second chance. (Peter and Jason only get together after Jason gets unaged!!)

entry.title: Conner Wayne doesn’t sound so bad
entry.summary:
Author: PurpleButterfly19

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 186,090Chapters: 35/?Kudos: 1,442

entry.title: You can take the boy from the circus
entry.summary:
Author: Gotham_Blight

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 34,601Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 208

Summary: Damian Al-Ghul Wayne had everything at one point. He was a prince. Ibn al Xu'ffasch. Son of the bat. Heir to the demon. He had never asked to be ripped away from everything that he knew, from the warmth of his home, his culture, his palace in Nanda Parbat. He had never asked to be shipped to a gloomy, grey city. Even when his father kept taking in orphans and ruining his plans for inheritance, Damian stood steadfast. But then his father died, leaving behind his newest orphan. A tiny acrobat with watery blue eyes and black curls, who spoke no English. Damian knew the boy never asked to be ripped away from everything that he knew, from the warmth of his home, his culture, his circus troupe. Damian knew he needed to be there for him.

entry.title: Dark Days and Lost Suns
entry.summary:
Author: Athena_Faymont

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 191,731Chapters: 23/?Kudos: 187

Summary: Clark admires Batman, the man who has given up civilian life to protect everyone else's, the tough, sharp, and compassionate man. Bruce admires Superman, the alien who, despite being able to dominate them all by force, has decided to take care of a planet that isn't his own.And, even with these two flawed principles, neither of them can imagine how alone the other feels... and how alone they themselves are. This is a long story, the superbat fanfic I've always wanted to write about how, within the canon, one day something changes and they find each other. If you want to join me on this adventure, we'll be here every Friday! [Puedes encontrarlo en español en mi perfil.]

entry.title: And Now It Follows Me Everyday
entry.summary:
Author: theFamousLivingDead

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 42,395Chapters: 13/?Kudos: 81

Summary: Gotham has a reputation that precedes itself, but these days even her city limits are overrun with chaos. The streets are littered with rumors about a new shape above the skyline. The docks have been taken over by gangs and civilians are forced to keep to a curfew for their own safety. Bruce Wayne is stumped when all his attempts to prevent crime from taking off in Gotham are thwarted by a lightningfast shadow. His worst nightmare comes true -- there is someone else out there, more powerful than he could ever train himself to be, and he's not on his side of history. In which Clark Kent went out to find more about himself and his origins, but the League of Assassins found him first.

entry.title: HAIL MARY
entry.summary:
Author: sleepyteatimebear

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,917Chapters: 5/32Kudos: 41

Summary: Clark 'Superman' Kent, is a shoe-in for the NFL draft, a tall, dimpled, All-American-Type, College Football's Jesus. Bruce is well-known for his intense dedication to collegiate journalism, his all-black closet and the billions promised to him upon graduation. Bruce wants to sweep at the Collegiate Emmy's, Clark wants to go pro. So, they make a deal. Bruce can produce a media campaign that rallies the public behind Clark before Draft Day. Bruce helps to upkeep the Wayne Media Enterprise legacy, and Clark gets good press. But then, Clark and Bruce spend game-day after game-day together. Bruce asks Clark questions, studies him, captures him, writes all of him down. What's even more peculiar is Clark starts asking questions back. Questions that make Bruce feel like Clark wants to know him as more than just his shadow for the season. They can’t fall in love. It wouldn’t make practical sense. It wouldn’t make emotional sense. But couldn't it?

entry.title: the eigth wonder of the world (you)
entry.summary:
Author: whoscountinganyway

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,558Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 1,097

Summary: Bruce Wayne meets Clark Kent, who he knows is Superman, and decides to mess with him as a way to see how long it will take him to piece together that the billionarie airhead playboy from Gotham is, in fact, the Knight of Darkness; Batman. If he's going to reveal himself, he's gonna have some fun first. Meanwhile, Superman, Clark Kent, Kal-El, whatever have you is very confused. Bruce Wayne is coming onto him whether he's in suit or not, and... he can't possibly know, right? But Batman is stoic as every, even if he is convincing him to, "Give it a try, Kal. If the date goes bad, freeze him." The Justice League gets convinced that Batman is dating someone in Gotham (when he really wants to date the Man of Steel), unaware he's calling home to his... however many kids that the man actually has. Shenanagins, introductions of all Robins and Gotahm vigilantes enuse, Green Lantern swears he sees Batman smile, but nobody believes him, and Clark falls deeper in love with both of Bruce Wayne's sides, and even the little hidden part he keeps to himself, too. He can't believe this is happeneing to him.

entry.title: congratulations, you adopted a spider!
entry.summary:
Author: maraudersmqry

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 95,593Chapters: 16/?Kudos: 2,453

Summary: Peter was meant to be forgotten, he didn’t think that meant being dropped in Gotham. Or in his eight-year-old body, in the least. Or with vigilantes trying to adopt him!   IN WHICH, Dr. Strange gave Peter one last chance at a life, instead of being emo around the faces who no longer recognized him.
